meanings.definition: A person who finds fault in small, unimportant details.
meanings.sent1: My sister is such a nitpicker when it comes to organizing her desk.
meanings.sent2: The nitpicker in the group always points out spelling mistakes in our presentations.
meanings.sent3: The nitpicker at the party noticed a tiny smudge on the mirror and couldn't resist cleaning it.
meanings.sent4: Her role as a nitpicker in the office earned her the nickname 'Detail Detective'.
meanings.sent5: Becoming a nitpicker about grammar helped him improve his writing skills.

meanings.definition: To criticize or make small, trivial objections.
meanings.sent1: Please don't nitpicker every little decision I make.
meanings.sent2: He tends to nitpicker about the font size in our documents.
meanings.sent3: She would nitpicker about the color of the sticky notes in the office.
meanings.sent4: The coach nitpickered every move the player made during the game.
meanings.sent5: Nitpickering about the presentation slides delayed the meeting.
